# HKAppleWalkingSteadinessClassification

**Enumeration**

A classification of a score based on the steadiness of the user’s gait.

## Declaration

```swift
enum HKAppleWalkingSteadinessClassification
```

## Overview

Walking Steadiness classifications measures the ability of the user to move with a steady, even gait. You can use the [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKAppleWalkingSteadinessClassificationForQuantity], [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKAppleWalkingSteadinessMaximumQuantityForClassification], and [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKAppleWalkingSteadinessMinimumQuantityForClassification] methods to convert between Walking Steadiness scores and the [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKAppleWalkingSteadinessClassification/low], [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKAppleWalkingSteadinessClassification/veryLow], or [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKAppleWalkingSteadinessClassification/ok] classifications.

## Accessing Classifications

- **HKAppleWalkingSteadinessClassification.ok**: A classification indicating that the stability of the user’s gait is within the normal range.
- **HKAppleWalkingSteadinessClassification.low**: A classification indicating that the stability of the user’s gate is below normal.
- **HKAppleWalkingSteadinessClassification.veryLow**: A classification indicating that the stability of the user’s gate is considerably below normal.

## Initializers

- **init(for:)**: Creates a new classification for the provided percentage.
- **init(rawValue:)**

## Instance Properties

- **maximum**: The minimum walking steadiness percentage for the classification.
- **minimum**: The maximum walking steadiness percentage for the classification.

## Default Implementations

- **CaseIterable Implementations**

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- CaseIterable
- Copyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
